results.title: Underground : Tales of Hacking, Madness and Obsession on the Electronic Frontier
results.title_for_label: Underground : Tales of Hacking, Madness and Obsession on the Electronic Frontier
results.description:
Suelette Dreyfus’ investigation of the early years of computer hacking, largely here in Melbourne, captures the philosophical foundation that saw a young Julian Assange lay the foundation for Wikileaks.

Buy or download the book on underground.net.
description_for_label:
Suelette Dreyfus’ investigation of the early years of computer hacking, largely here in Melbourne, captures the philosophical foundation that saw a young Julian Assange lay the foundation for Wikileaks.

results.title: La Jetee
results.brief_description: Set in Paris after the Third World War; an imprisoned man is being used by scientists to investigate time travel. He is haunted by a childhood memory of the pier at Orly Airport, a woman’s face, a man’s death. The fiction is constructed through still photographs. Photographs - images of the past - thus replace moving images with their power to create the illusion of the present. Script by Catherine Varlin, Chris Marker.
results.description:
“A heartbreaking love story that uses still images to entwine the past, present and future in a time-travelling masterpiece.” – filmmaker and The Futures & Other Fictions advisory group member Robert Connolly

results.title: It's Oh So Quiet

constellations_other.name: Outliers of the Hollywood Musical
constellations_other.description: It might feel like the musical genre has been having a rest since the golden age of cinema, but you only need to look at the enormous number of music videos that have been produced - especially since the launch of MTV in 1981 - to realise that it has not. These days, if we count narrative-based music videos, the overwhelming majority are made are short, snappy and live outside of the Hollywood studio system.

results.media_note: Sorry, we aren't able to make images or video for this item available to the public online.

results.title: Clint Eastwood
results.creator_credit: Ray Atherton and Passport International Entertainment
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Hollywood remembers”.
Speak softly and carry a big gun…that’s the attitude that has made Clint Eastwood one of the biggest box office stars! And this video looks at his entire film career, from the early “Spaghetti Westerns”made in Italy to his Hollywood superstar years with “Dirty Harry” and beyond. Featured are rare film clips, original coming attractions, previews, and more, including footage never released to television. It’s a treasure trove featuring Eastwood’s best work, and the first serious retrospective of his lengthy acting career. Whether you’re an Eastwood fan, a film buff, or an action-adventure afficionado, this is a video you’ll want to watch over and over again.

results.title: Gorillaz: Clint Eastwood

constellations_other.name: Dystopian Futures & Horrific Pasts
constellations_other.description: For an industry that leans strongly toward happy endings, it's interesting to note that a lot of futures that are speculated in film are dystopic.  However we don't need to look too far to find horrors in the past and present.

results.media_note: Sorry, we aren't able to make images or video for this item available to the public online.

results.title: Arcade Fire: Sprawl II (Mountains Beyond Mountains) (2011)

constellations_other.name: Beyond Biophilia
constellations_other.description: The concert film sits prominently at the intersection between film and music.  Concert films often attract key creators from the more traditional cinema landscape and Björk: Biophilia Live exemplifies this with it's co-directors Nick Fenton and Peter Strickland.

results.media_note: Sorry, we aren't able to make images or video for this item available to the public online.

results.title: Air: Playground Love

constellations_other.name: Beyond Biophilia
constellations_other.description: The concert film sits prominently at the intersection between film and music.  Concert films often attract key creators from the more traditional cinema landscape and Björk: Biophilia Live exemplifies this with it's co-directors Nick Fenton and Peter Strickland.

results.description: Kirsten Dunst stars in the music video for Air’s Playground Love from the Virgin Suicides soundtrack. The music video features clips from the film blended with new footage revealing teen life from the perspective of singing chewing gum.
description_for_label: Kirsten Dunst stars in the music video for Air’s Playground Love from the Virgin Suicides soundtrack. The music video features clips from the film blended with new footage revealing teen life from the perspective of singing chewing gum.
